chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 22, 1866, after confirmation.

Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 13, 1886, after confirmation.

ended.note: Left post on or shortly after

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 13, 1905, after confirmation.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate. Armour left post on March 4, 1933; he returned on March 8, and presented a copy of his letter of credence under his new appointment, March 23, 1933.

ended.note: Promoted to Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 30, 1962, after confirmation. Relations had not yet resumed when Thurston left post on May 26, 1963. On June 14, 1963 the Government of Haiti requested Thurstonâ€™s recall, and he did not return to post.
Not commissioned; nomination rejected by the Senate.
Took oath of office, but did not proceed to post.
